sentences: Ma tean kellegagi, kes oskab seda teha.
Ta on kellegagi tuttav, kuid ma ei tea, kes see on.
Kellegagi peab olema valmis seda Ã¼lesandega tegelema.
context: The word 'kellegagi' is used in Estonian to refer to an unspecified person or someone, similar to the English words 'someone' or 'somebody'. It is often used in sentences where the identity of the person is not important or is unknown.
